author: card.afterdark
title: Cardano After Dark - Hold'em poker
description: 1亿多扑克玩家在集中式扑克平台上玩耍，这些平台持有他们的资金并收取高额费用。

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal identifies the problem of millions of poker players having to deal with centralized entities charging high fees. They will ad value to  the Cardano ecosystem by bringing lots of poker players to the Cardano blockchain. The key metrics of this project is in line with the Challenge setting's in the sense of user and transaction growth. This project is able to scale because it will be made open source.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevant skills and team has been provided with links to their Github/LinkeIn pages. The budget is reasonable and broken down into identifiable items with rates per hour. 6 Months to complete this project is reasonable. They explain in great detail all the extra features they will ad to protect players and they've attached 2 IOHK papers covering some of the game mechanics they would have to ad. They don't however go into the technical details of what they will use to develop the frontend and backend. Providing the reader with these details will reveal a lot about your skills and will boost voter confidence. They have considered the risk of addiction and will ad features that incentivize game stops.
f6_assessments.q2: Their roadmap is broken into  2 parts. 3 months and 6 months. Each with their own milestones making it easy to track the progress of this project. They listed quite a few KPIs that are easy to measure, making it very easy to measure the performance of this project. They address the problem of poker players having to deal with centralized entities holding their funds and charging high fees and solve this by creating an open source decentralized platform where players can play directly from their wallets with low fees.
f6_assessments.reply: Unfortunately we were not able to add many technical details since we hadn't decided on the backend-language before the proposal closed. Thank you for your assessment :)

f6_assessments.q0: Wow, this proposal has it all: applying academic research into a real world setting, developing new tech for Cardano that can be learned from and reused by the community, an aspect of social responsibility - and it is also a fun game to boot! This project touches all the keystones of what makes Cardano special and perfectly exemplifies what is laid out in the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The team is a stacked with highly experienced individuals who each bring their strengths to different aspects of the projects and you can just imagine how they would join together to create something fantastic. For what they are setting out to do, the amount of funding requested seems like a bargain.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal breaks down the budget and lays out a timeline - the MVP would be completed after 6 months. They specify a set of functional requirements that make it easy to determine if what they have set to do has been accomplished.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for this feedback, this feedback really gave us some motivation to move forward! :)

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal problem statement and solution are aligned with the challenge. This proposal also clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem by creating a decentralized poker-platform where players can play for cryptocurrencies directly from their wallets with minimum fees. Also, the key metrics and goals of this proposal are aligned with the outlined challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provided evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the project. The proposer also knows the required manpower and resources to successfully implement the project. The budget presented is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable terms. Moreover, the budget requested are reasonable to achieve the set goals. Furthermore, this proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation. However, the proposer fails to provide a risk management plan. 
What is your contingency plan if there are challenges along the way that requires additional funding?
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. The proposer also provided key metrics and KPI that define the success of the proposal. Moreover, the proposer provided information on where the voters can keep track of their work progress.
f6_assessments.reply:
Thank you very much for this generous assessment!
As you correctly pointed out we have not addressed the risks which is especially hurtful because we have identified some of them already. Like the 1 year roadmap of hydra, a piece of software that is essential for our project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I feel this proposal very effectively addresses the challenge, and does so in a very compelling way. By ridding the platform of any central entity they ensure that this platform is government resistant and will allow a global audience to utilise the Cardano blockchain for online poker. 

What's unique about this proposal is they aim to incentivize curbing addiction and it will be very interesting to see what the team's solution to this is. 

If the incentive structure is set up properly to reward those who gamble responsibly then this could really be an absolute game changer, and go a long way to legalisation in localities where it us currently banned, as the argument against online gambling would fade away as good behaviour is incentivized and thus harm is reduced or atleast curbed in some way.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has not only a Plutus developer, but a former catalyst CA, Emurgo students and even a PhD. This team is a very qualified and accomplished team from the information available. The team has went above and beyond in including social media profiles and GitHub profiles readily available and are willing to put themselves and their credentials out there proves to me this team is very serious, and combined with their qualifications is highly likely to succeed! 

I strongly feel this is one proposal in this gamers on-chained category that will likely succeed.
f6_assessments.q2: I actually believe the one area this proposal is kind of lacking is the roadmap, the milestones are included which is great but they themselves area  little vague and could use more details and some KPIs for each milestone would go a long way in making this proposal highly-auditable. I still think the roadmap is reasonable and goes further than other proposals so I still have to gives 4 stars on auditability.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you very much for your assessment and trust in us! :)

f6_assessments.q0:
I think this game title will say out loud, it will drive a million users to Cardano network. Moreover, with their purpose of developing this game and even becoming a platform in the future, I believe that it will get an amazing effect when publishing, why don't poker players come to play here when it's better than a ton of others. 
More than that, their key metrics have some sexy numbers and all connect to the challenge settings, really want to see how success this game will be.
f6_assessments.q1:
I recommend to the team that you should give us more detail about the roadmap in your development phase (six months), better is to divide it into months with the detail of features or tech that you will finish in that scope. Because it can help us to assess that, is the budget breakdown you show fit with your work or not? And it will also help Catalyst audit your progress when funded. Moreover, I think this project also has some risks and legal obstacles, hope that you guys can figure out some and get some plan to get rid of them. 
By the way, the team also provide some info about the team and referral files of their next steps. It's really helpful.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap in the proposal is not detailed enough for helping to audit, but I hope that team can detail it in your attached linked file to help everyone audit your project better. The proposal also has good key metrics and KPIs that I believe that when successfully get it, this game will affect strongly to Caradano ecosystem. 
Last but not least, they have a very detailed explanation about how this game will help to beat the problem, more than that their purpose is very meaningful to poker player communities. So I will 100% support this team for finish it.
f6_assessments.reply:
Thank you for taking the time and giving us this great assessment!
I would like to point out that I am very happy with the roadmap (three- and six month) since it gives us some wiggle-room and doesn't pin us down too much, I made every effort to point out this is going to be an iterative approach and exact month by month deadlines are not what we wanted. Also this way of discribing the roadmap is widely used within Catalyst.
With that being said, I understand that we could have been more objective oriented in the budget-breakdown and not describe the hours paid, which are probably unrealistic due to the nature of the project.
Again, thank you for your assessment. :)

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree with their proposal of creatinh a decentralised poker-platform where players can play for cryptocurrencies directly from their wallets with minimum fees. Obviously, this will be able to solve the challenge earlier mentioned thiu, 100+ million poker players are playing on centralised Poker-platforms which are holding their money and are charging high fees. The proposal when implemented will go a long way to give comfort and convenience hence solving the problem of high fees as well. 
I score them 4 on this.
f6_assessments.q1:
For every well thought proposal I believe that the plan, impact, strategy and feasibility matters so well. For this proposal I think their plan and experiences were well presented.

The proposers presented a well laid out timeline of executing the proposal. Which is commendable.

The experiences of the team as well as the various references were well presented. It's an indication that they have a track record of other projects they have executed. I therefore rate this with a score if 5.
f6_assessments.q2: From my review of this proposal, I think it's clear the team of proposers provides a clear-cut plan and strategy for the successful implementation with very clear milestones and well laid out timelines. There are also several metrics that measure the success of this project. What I recommend the proposers should consider adding going forward is the challenges they anticipate in adding. This is because if proposed solution is successfully implemented it provides a useful solution to the targeted problem. For every legitimate and understanding proposal, there is the for the proposer to be aware of the challenges, but it is easier for outsiders to understand if a statement is made. Therefore, I rate this with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.reply:
Thank you for this review! Unfortunately you don't provide any rationale on why you score the proposal with 4 instead of 5, while writing that you agree with it.
Also I am not sure what you mean with 'What I recommend the proposers should consider adding going forward is the challenges they anticipate in adding...' In case you are asking us to put a challenge into the proposal that we are thinking of proposing in, in future funds, we can't do that because we don't know which challenges there will be in Fund 8, 9 and forward.

-> It's a pity but I guess this assessment should be filtered out... a wise vCA will know what to do!
